description: Borrowed from Middle French desparat, from Latin disparātus, past participle of disparō (“to divide”), from dis- (“apart”) + parō (“to make equal”), from par (“equal”).

adjectives.description: disparate (comparative more disparate, superlative most disparate)

entries.meaning: Composed of inherently different or distinct elements; incongruous.
examples: The board of the company was decidedly disparate, with no two members from the same social or economic background.

entries.meaning: Essentially different; of different species, unlike but not opposed in pairs
Utterly unlike; incapable of being compared; having no common ground.
(chiefly in the plural) Any of a group of unequal or dissimilar things.
